column11: target_content
column12: justification

column11: ETS2. Contribution of the buildings and road transport sectors of 43% emission reductions by 2030 compared to 2005 and of the additional sectors, a combined cost-efficient contribution of 42% emission reductions by 2030 compared to 2005
column12: This target is assigned to Greenhouse Gas Emissions as it directly addresses the reduction of emissions in various sectors.

column11: ETS2. Contribution of the buildings and road transport sectors of 43% emission reductions by 2030 compared to 2005 and of the additional sectors, a combined cost-efficient contribution of 42% emission reductions by 2030 compared to 2005
column12: This target is also assigned to Emission Reduction as it aims to reduce emissions by a specific percentage.

column11: ESR. Increased national targets in line with an EU-wide reduction of 40% in the ESR sectors compared to 2005. Member States contribute to the overall EU reduction in 2030 with targets ranging from -10% to -50% below 2005 level (sectors: transport, buildings, agriculture and waste)
column12: This target is assigned to Emission Reduction as it aims to increase national targets for reducing emissions.

column11: ESR. Increased national targets in line with an EU-wide reduction of 40% in the ESR sectors compared to 2005. Member States contribute to the overall EU reduction in 2030 with targets ranging from -10% to -50% below 2005 level (sectors: transport, buildings, agriculture and waste)
column12: This target is also assigned to Greenhouse Gas Emissions as it addresses the reduction of emissions in various sectors.

column11: Reduce by at least 55% net GHG emissions compared to 1990 levels, by 2030
column12: This target is assigned to Greenhouse Gas Emissions Reduction as it directly aims to reduce net GHG emissions.

column11: Achieve climate neutrality by 2050
column12: This target is assigned to Climate Neutrality as it aims to achieve a balance between GHG emissions and removals.

column11: Reach energy neutrality in the wastewater treatment sector by 2045
column12: This target is assigned to Energy Efficiency as it aims to reduce energy consumption in the wastewater treatment sector.

column11: Reduce methane emissions by 35 to 37% compared to 2005 levels, by 2030
column12: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Reducing Greenhouse Gas Emissions" because it specifically aims to decrease methane emissions, a potent greenhouse gas.
column13: The target is also related to climate ambition, as reducing methane emissions contributes to the overall goal of mitigating climate change.

column11: Reduce methane emissions by 35 to 37% compared to 2005 levels, by 2030
column12: This target is also assigned to the sub-theme "Improving Energy Efficiency" because reducing methane emissions can be achieved through more efficient use of energy, especially in the energy sector.
column13: Methane emissions are often a result of inefficient energy production and use, so improving energy efficiency can help reduce these emissions.

column11: EU ETS. The contribution of the sectors covered by the existing EU Emission trading System (EU ETS) with respect to the EU Climate ambition should be of -62% compared to 2005 (increasing the linear emissions reduction factor from 2.2% per year up to 4.4%), by 2030
column12: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Carbon Pricing" because it involves the EU ETS, which is a carbon pricing mechanism.
column13: The target aims to increase the ambition of the EU ETS by increasing the linear emissions reduction factor, which will lead to a greater reduction in greenhouse gas emissions.

column11: EU ETS. The contribution of the sectors covered by the existing EU Emission trading System (EU ETS) with respect to the EU Climate ambition should be of -62% compared to 2005 (increasing the linear emissions reduction factor from 2.2% per year up to 4.4%), by 2030
column12: This target is also assigned to the sub-theme "Reducing Greenhouse Gas Emissions" because it aims to reduce emissions from sectors covered by the EU ETS.
column13: The increased ambition of the EU ETS will lead to a greater reduction in greenhouse gas emissions, contributing to the overall goal of mitigating climate change.

column11: Reduce greenhouse gas emissions by at least 55% by 2030
column12: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Greenhouse Gas Emissions Reduction" because it directly aims to reduce emissions.

column11: Achieve climate neutrality by 2050
column12: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Climate Neutrality" because it sets a long-term goal for the EU to become climate neutral.

column11: Member States shall ensure that the contribution of renewable fuels of non-biological origin used for final energy and non-energy purposes shall be at least 42% of the hydrogen used for final energy and non-energy purposes in industry by 2030, and 60% by 2035.
column12: This target is assigned to Renewable Energy as it promotes the use of renewable fuels.

column11: Member States shall ensure that the contribution of renewable fuels of non-biological origin used for final energy and non-energy purposes shall be at least 42% of the hydrogen used for final energy and non-energy purposes in industry by 2030, and 60% by 2035.
column12: This target is also assigned to Hydrogen Production as it addresses the use of hydrogen in industry.

column11: Energy demand to be covered by solar heat and geothermal should at least triple (rate is currently at 1.5%)
column12: This target is assigned to Solar Energy as it promotes the use of solar heat.

column11: Energy demand to be covered by solar heat and geothermal should at least triple (rate is currently at 1.5%)
column12: This target is also assigned to Geothermal Energy as it addresses the use of geothermal energy.

column11: Over this decade, the EU will need to install, on average, approximately 45 GW per year of PV to reach the share of 45% of energy coming from renewables set out in the REPowerEU Plan.
column12: This target is assigned to Solar Energy as it promotes the installation of PV.

column11: Member States shall collectively ensure that the share of energy from renewable sources in the Union’s gross final consumption of energy in 2030 is at least 42.5%.
column12: This target is assigned to Renewable Energy as it promotes the use of renewable energy sources.

column11: By 31 December 2025, each Member State shall agree to establish a framework for cooperation on joint projects with one or more other Member States for the production of renewable energy, subject to the following: by 31 December 2030, Member States shall endeavour to agree on establishing at least two joint projects
column12: This target is assigned to Renewable Energy Cooperation as it promotes cooperation between Member States.

column11: By 31 December 2025, each Member State shall agree to establish a framework for cooperation on joint projects with one or more other Member States for the production of renewable energy, subject to the following: by 31 December 2030, Member States shall endeavour to agree on establishing at least two joint projects
column12: This target is also assigned to Joint Projects as it addresses the establishment of joint projects.

column11: Each Member State shall ensure that at least 3% of the total floor area of heated and/or cooled buildings (of buildings which have a total useful floor area of over 250 m2 and are not nearly-zero energy buildings) that are owned by public bodies is renovated each year to be transformed into at least nearly zero-energy buildings or zero-emission buildings in accordance with Article 9 of Directive 2010/31/EU.
column12: This target is assigned to Building Renovation as it promotes the renovation of buildings.

column11: At least double the annual energy renovation rate of residential and non-residential buildings by 2030 and to foster deep energy renovations.
column12: This target is assigned to Building Renovation as it promotes the increase of energy renovation rate.

column11: At least double the annual energy renovation rate of residential and non-residential buildings by 2030 and to foster deep energy renovations.
column12: This target is also assigned to Energy Efficiency as it addresses the improvement of energy efficiency.

column11: Member States shall ensure that the average primary energy use of the entire residential building stock decreases by at least 16% compared to 2020 by 2030, and by at least 20-22% compared to 2020 by 2035
column12: This target is assigned to Energy Efficiency as it promotes the reduction of primary energy use.

column11: Around 30% of EU primary steel production is expected to be decarbonised on the basis of renewable hydrogen.
column12: This target is assigned to Hydrogen Production as it addresses the use of renewable hydrogen in steel production.

column11: Double the current deployment rate of individual heat pumps, resulting in a cumulative 10 million units by 2027 and 30 million units by 2030
column12: This target is assigned to Heating and Cooling as it aims to increase the deployment of heat pumps.

column11: Bring online over 320 GW of solar photovoltaic by 2025 and almost 600 GW by 2030
column12: This target is assigned to Solar Energy as it aims to increase the capacity of solar photovoltaic.

column11: Increase the share of renewable energy in the heating and cooling sector by at least 1.1 percentage points as an annual average calculated for the period 2026 to 2030
column12: This target is assigned to Renewable Energy as it aims to increase the share of renewable energy in the heating and cooling sector.

column11: Ensure that the total final energy consumption of all public bodies combined is reduced by at least 1.9% each year, when compared to 2021
column12: This target is assigned to Energy Efficiency as it aims to reduce energy consumption in public bodies.

column11: Ensure that the average primary energy use of the entire residential building stock in EU Member States decreases by at least 16% compared to 2020 by 2030
column12: This target is assigned to Energy Efficiency as it aims to reduce energy consumption in residential buildings.

column11: Ensure that at least 3% of the total floor area of heated and/or cooled buildings owned by public bodies is renovated each year to be transformed into at least nearly zero-energy buildings
column12: This target is assigned to Building Renovation as it aims to renovate public buildings to increase energy efficiency.

column11: Over this decade, the EU will need to install, on average, approximately 45 GW per year of PV to reach the share of 45% of energy coming from renewables set out in the REPowerEU Plan
column12: This target is assigned to Solar Energy as it aims to increase the capacity of solar photovoltaic.

column11: Reduce greenhouse gas emissions from the transport sector by 90% by 2050
column12: This target is assigned to Transport Emissions Reduction as it aims to reduce GHG emissions from the transport sector.

column11: Increase the share of renewable energy in the transport sector to at least 14% by 2030
column12: This target is assigned to Renewable Energy as it aims to increase the share of renewable energy in the transport sector.

column11: Set an indicative target for innovative renewable energy technology of at least 5% of newly installed renewable energy capacity by 2030
column12: This target is assigned to Innovative Renewable Energy as it aims to increase the share of innovative renewable energy technologies.

column11: The amount of renewable fuels and renewable electricity supplied to the transport sector leads to a: (i) share of renewable energy within the final consumption of energy in the transport sector of at least 29 % by 2030, or (ii) GHG intensity reduction of at least 14.5 % by 2030, compared to the baseline set out in Article 27(1), in accordance with an indicative trajectory set by the Member State.
column12: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Promoting Renewable Energy" because it aims to increase the share of renewable energy in the transport sector.
column13: The target also mentions a GHG intensity reduction, which is related to reducing greenhouse gas emissions, but the primary focus is on promoting renewable energy.

column11: The amount of renewable fuels and renewable electricity supplied to the transport sector leads to a: (i) share of renewable energy within the final consumption of energy in the transport sector of at least 29 % by 2030, or (ii) GHG intensity reduction of at least 14.5 % by 2030, compared to the baseline set out in Article 27(1), in accordance with an indicative trajectory set by the Member State.
column12: This target is also assigned to the sub-theme "Reducing Greenhouse Gas Emissions" because it mentions a GHG intensity reduction, which is a key aspect of reducing greenhouse gas emissions.
column13: The target aims to reduce the carbon footprint of the transport sector, which is a significant contributor to greenhouse gas emissions.

column11: By 2022, achieve 18% of the total increase in the share of energy from renewable sources between that Member State’s binding 2020 national target, and its contribution to the 2030 target of the share of energy from renewable sources in gross final consumption of energy.
column12: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Promoting Renewable Energy" because it aims to increase the share of energy from renewable sources.
column13: The target sets a specific milestone for 2022, which is part of the overall effort to promote renewable energy and reduce dependence on fossil fuels.

column11: A target of 15% electricity interconnection for 2030
column12: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Improving Energy Infrastructure" because it aims to increase electricity interconnection between member states.
column13: Increasing electricity interconnection can help to improve the overall efficiency and resilience of the energy system, and facilitate the integration of renewable energy sources.

column11: Reduce buildings’ final energy consumption by 14%
column12: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Improving Energy Efficiency" because it aims to reduce the final energy consumption of buildings.
column13: Reducing energy consumption in buildings can be achieved through various measures such as improving insulation, using energy-efficient appliances, and optimizing heating and cooling systems.

column11: By 2030, the share of renewable energy in the electricity mix should double to 55-60%, and projections show a share of around 84% by 2050.
column12: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Promoting Renewable Energy" because it aims to increase the share of renewable energy in the electricity mix.
column13: Doubling the share of renewable energy in the electricity mix by 2030 is an ambitious goal that requires significant investment and effort to promote renewable energy sources such as solar and wind power.

column11: Set up at least one renewables-based energy community in every municipality with a population higher than 10,000 by 2025
column12: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Renewable Energy Communities" because it promotes the development of community-based renewable energy projects.

column11: Increase the share of renewable energy in the energy mix to at least 32% by 2030
column12: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Renewable Energy Share" because it aims to increase the proportion of renewable energy in the overall energy mix.

column11: Improve energy efficiency by reducing energy consumption by at least 32.5% by 2030
column12: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Energy Efficiency" because it focuses on reducing energy consumption through efficient use.

column11: Increase the share of renewable energy in heating and cooling to at least 21% by 2030
column12: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Renewable Heating and Cooling" because it specifically targets the heating and cooling sector for renewable energy integration.

column11: Reduce greenhouse gas emissions from transport by at least 60% by 2050
column12: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Sustainable Transport" because it aims to significantly reduce emissions from the transport sector.

column11: Deploy alternative fuels and zero-emission vehicles
column12: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Alternative Fuels and Vehicles" because it promotes the use of alternative fuels and zero-emission vehicles for transport.

column11: Over this decade, the EU will need to install, on average, approximately 45 GW per year of PV to reach the share of 45% of energy coming from renewables set out in the REPowerEU Plan
column12: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Solar Energy" because it specifically mentions the installation of photovoltaic (PV) capacity to meet renewable energy targets.

column2: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column11: All recycling shall achieve at least the following targets for recovery of materials: - No later than 31 December 2027, 90% for cobalt, copper, lead, nickel,  - No later than 31 December 2031, 95% for cobalt, copper, lead, nickel
column12: This target is assigned to Material Recovery as it promotes the recovery of materials.

column2: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column11: Double EU’s circular material use rate in the coming decade
column12: This target is assigned to Circular Economy as it promotes the increase of circular material use rate.

column2: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column11: By 2030, Union recycling capacity, including for all intermediate recycling steps, should be able of producing at least 25% of the Union’s annual consumption of strategic raw materials and should be able of recycling significantly increasing amounts of each strategic raw material from waste.
column12: This target is assigned to Recycling as it promotes the increase of recycling capacity.

column2: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column11: Producers of starting, lighting and ignition batteries, industrial batteries and electric vehicle batteries or, where appointed in accordance with Article 57(1), producer responsibility organisations, shall take back, free of charge and without an obligation on the end-user to buy a new battery, nor to have bought the battery from them, and shall ensure that all waste starting, lighting and ignition batteries, waste industrial batteries and waste electric vehicle batteries regardless of their nature, chemical composition, condition, brand, or origin of the respective category that they have made available on the market for the first time in the territory of that Member State are collected separately.
column12: This target is assigned to Battery Recycling as it addresses the collection and recycling of batteries.

column2: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column11: Recycling shall achieve at least the following targets for recycling efficiency: No later than 31 December 2025 - 75% by average weight of lead-acid batteries, - 80% by average weight of nickel-cadmium batteries - 50% by average weight of other waste batteries No later than 31 December 2030 - 80% by average weight of lead-acid batteries,
column12: This target is assigned to Recycling Efficiency as it promotes the increase of recycling efficiency.

column2: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column11: Recycling shall achieve at least the following targets for recycling efficiency: - No later than 31 December 2025, 65% by average weight of lithium-based batteries, - No later than 31 December 2030, 70% by average weight of lithium-based batteries.
column12: This target is assigned to Recycling Efficiency as it promotes the increase of recycling efficiency.

column2: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column11: Reduce the generation of food waste per capita, jointly in retail and other distribution of food, in restaurants and food services and in households, by 30% in comparison to the amount generated in 2020
column12: This target is assigned to Food Waste Reduction as it promotes the reduction of food waste.

column2: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column11: All packaging shall be recyclable
column12: This target is assigned to Packaging Recycling as it promotes the recyclability of packaging.

column2: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column11: Produce at least 40% of the Union’s annual consumption of strategic raw materials by 2030
column12: This target is assigned to Raw Materials Production as it aims to increase the production of strategic raw materials.

column2: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column11: Recycle at least 25% of the Union’s annual consumption of strategic raw materials by 2030
column12: This target is assigned to Raw Materials Recycling as it aims to increase the recycling of strategic raw materials.

column2: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column11: Increase the circular material use rate to 23% by 2030
column12: This target is assigned to Circular Economy as it aims to increase the circular material use rate.

column2: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column11: Reduce waste generation by 50% by 2030
column12: This target is assigned to Waste Reduction as it aims to reduce waste generation.

column2: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column11: Increase the recycling rate of municipal waste to 65% by 2030
column12: This target is assigned to Waste Recycling as it aims to increase the recycling rate of municipal waste.

column2: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column11: Reduce the generation of food waste by 50% by 2030
column12: This target is assigned to Food Waste Reduction as it aims to reduce food waste generation.

column2: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column11: Increase the use of recycled materials in packaging to 30% by 2030
column12: This target is assigned to Sustainable Packaging as it aims to increase the use of recycled materials in packaging.

column2: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column11: By 2030, Union extraction capacity should be able of extracting the ores, minerals or concentrates needed to produce at least 10% of the Union’s annual consumption of strategic raw materials, to the extent possible in light of the Union’s reserves.
column12: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Promoting Sustainable Resource Use" because it aims to increase the Union's extraction capacity for strategic raw materials.
column13: The target is part of the effort to promote sustainable resource use and reduce dependence on imported raw materials, which can help to improve the security of supply and reduce the environmental impact of resource extraction.

column2: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column11: Producers of portable batteries or, where appointed in accordance with Article 57(1), producer responsibility organisations, shall attain, and maintain durably, at least the following collection targets for waste portable batteries: - 45% by 31 December 2023, - 63% by 31 December 2027, - 73% by 31 December 2030.
column12: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Improving Waste Management" because it aims to increase the collection rate of waste portable batteries.
column13: The target is part of the effort to improve waste management and reduce the environmental impact of waste, by promoting the collection and recycling of waste batteries.

column2: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column11: Reduce the generation of food waste in processing and manufacturing by 10% in comparison to the amount generated in 2020
column12: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Reducing Food Waste" because it aims to reduce the generation of food waste in processing and manufacturing.
column13: The target is part of the effort to reduce food waste and improve the efficiency of the food system, by reducing the amount of food that is wasted during processing and manufacturing.

column2: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column11: The plastic part in packaging shall contain the following minimum percentage of recycled content recovered from post-consumer plastic waste, per unit of packaging: From 1 January 2030 (i) 30% for contact sensitive packaging made from polyethylene terephthalate (PET) as major component, (ii) 10% for contact sensitive made from plastic materials other than PET, except single use plastic bottles, (iii) 30% for single use plastic beverage bottles, (iv) 35% for other plastic packaging
column12: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Promoting Recycling" because it aims to increase the use of recycled content in packaging.
column13: The target is part of the effort to promote recycling and reduce the environmental impact of packaging, by increasing the use of recycled materials in packaging.

column2: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column11: Member States shall take the necessary measures to attain the recycling targets of 65% by weight of all packaging waste generated by 31 December 2025, and of 70% by weight of all packaging waste generated by 31 December 2030.
column12: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Improving Waste Management" because it aims to increase the recycling rate of packaging waste.
column13: The target is part of the effort to improve waste management and reduce the environmental impact of waste, by promoting the recycling of packaging waste.

column2: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column11: Member States shall take the necessary measures to attain a recycling target of 70% of glass by weight of glass contained in packaging waste generated by 31 December 2025 and of 75% by 31 December 2030
column12: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Promoting Recycling" because it aims to increase the recycling rate of glass packaging waste.
column13: The target is part of the effort to promote recycling and reduce the environmental impact of packaging, by increasing the recycling rate of glass packaging waste.

column2: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column11: The plastic contained in each vehicle type that is type-approved as of [the first day of the month following 72 months after the date of entry into force of the Regulation] under Regulation (EU) 2018/858 shall contain a minimum of 25 % of plastic recycled by weight from post-consumer plastic waste.
column12: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Promoting Recycling" because it aims to increase the use of recycled plastic in vehicles.
column13: The target is part of the effort to promote recycling and reduce the environmental impact of vehicles, by increasing the use of recycled materials in vehicle production.

column2: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column11: Halve the amount of residual (non-recycled) municipal waste by 2030
column12: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Waste Reduction" because it aims to reduce the amount of non-recycled municipal waste.

column2: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column11: Increase recycling rates to at least 65% by 2030
column12: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Recycling Rates" because it focuses on increasing the proportion of waste that is recycled.

column2: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column11: Reduce the amount of plastic waste in oceans by 50% by 2030
column12: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Plastic Waste Reduction" because it specifically targets the reduction of plastic waste in oceans.

column2: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column11: Increase the use of recycled materials in production processes
column12: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Circular Economy" because it promotes the use of recycled materials in production, aligning with circular economy principles.

column2: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column11: Reduce greenhouse gas emissions from industry by at least 80% by 2050
column12: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Industrial Emissions Reduction" because it aims to significantly reduce emissions from industrial activities.

column11: Achieve an annual production of sustainable biomethane of 35 billion cubic meters by 2030
column12: This target is assigned to Biomethane Production as it promotes the production of sustainable biomethane.

column11: Of the SAF targets reported above, synthetic aviation fuels should represent a minimum share of 1.2% from 2030, 5% from 2035, 10% from 2034, 15% from 2045, and 35% from 2050.
column12: This target is assigned to Sustainable Aviation Fuels as it promotes the use of synthetic aviation fuels.

column11: Cut the emissions of transport sector by 90% by 2050 relative to 1990.
column12: This target is assigned to Transport Emissions Reduction as it promotes the reduction of emissions in the transport sector.

column11: EU fisheries are encouraged to continue the positive trend, as observed for the period 2009-2019, towards reducing fuel intensity by reducing the fossil-fuel consumption per kg of landed product for at least an additional 15% for the period 2019-2030.
column12: This target is assigned to Fuel Efficiency as it promotes the reduction of fuel consumption.

column11: For [...] “urban buses” manufacturers shall comply with the 90% (in the reporting period 2030-2034) and 100% (as from 2035) minimum shares in their fleet of new heavy-duty vehicles
column12: This target is assigned to Electric Vehicles as it promotes the use of electric buses.

column11: Member States shall ensure that, at the end of each year, the following power output targets are met cumulatively: (a) for each light-duty battery electric vehicle registered in their territory, a total power output of at least 1.3 kW is provided through publicly accessible recharging stations, and (b) for each light-duty plug-in hybrid vehicle registered in their territory, a total power output of at least 0.80 kW is provided through publicly accessible recharging stations.
column12: This target is assigned to Charging Infrastructure as it promotes the development of recharging stations.

column11: Member States shall ensure that along the TEN-T core and comprehensive network, publicly accessible recharging pools dedicated to light-duty vehicles deployed in each direction of travel with a maximum distance of 60 km in-between them offering a power output of at least 600kW and including at least one recharging point with an individual power output of at least 150 kW.
column12: This target is assigned to Charging Infrastructure as it promotes the development of recharging pools.

column11: By 31 December 2030, in each urban node publicly accessible recharging points dedicated to heavy-duty electric vehicles with an aggregated power output of at least 1 800 kW are deployed, provided by recharging stations with an individual power output of at least 150 kW.
column12: This target is assigned to Charging Infrastructure as it promotes the development of recharging points for heavy-duty electric vehicles.

column11: Member States shall ensure that at least one installation providing shore-side electricity supply to inland waterway vessels is deployed at all TEN-T core inland waterway ports by 1 January 2025, at least one installation providing shore-side electricity supply to inland waterway vessels is deployed at all TEN-T comprehensive inland waterway ports by 1 January 2030.
column12: This target is assigned to Electrification of Transport as it promotes the use of shore-side electricity supply.

column11: Reduce the average CO2 emissions of new heavy-duty motor vehicles by 90% by 2040
column12: This target is assigned to Transport Emissions Reduction as it aims to reduce CO2 emissions from heavy-duty motor vehicles.

column11: Increase the share of alternative fuels in the transport sector to at least 24% by 2030
column12: This target is assigned to Alternative Fuels as it aims to increase the share of alternative fuels in the transport sector.

column11: Deploy at least 3 million public charging points for electric vehicles by 2030
column12: This target is assigned to Electric Vehicle Charging as it aims to increase the number of public charging points for electric vehicles.

column11: Increase the share of sustainable aviation fuels in the aviation sector to at least 2% by 2025
column12: This target is assigned to Sustainable Aviation Fuels as it aims to increase the share of sustainable aviation fuels in the aviation sector.

column11: Reduce the emissions from the maritime transport sector by 50% by 2050
column12: This target is assigned to Maritime Emissions Reduction as it aims to reduce emissions from the maritime transport sector.

column11: The yearly average GHG intensity of the energy used on board by a ship during a reporting period shall be reduced, compared to the reference value (91.16 gCO2e/MJ) by: 2% from 1 January 2025, 6% from 1 January 2030, 14.5% from 1 January 2035, 31% from 1 January 2040, 62% from 1 January 2045, 80% from 1 January 2050.
column12: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Reducing Greenhouse Gas Emissions" because it aims to reduce the GHG intensity of energy used on board ships.
column13: The target is part of the effort to reduce greenhouse gas emissions from the transport sector, by promoting the use of cleaner fuels and more efficient ships.

column11: Each Member State shall set an obligation on fuel suppliers to ensure that: (B) the combined share of advanced biofuels and biogas produced from the feedstock listed in Part A of Annex IX and of renewable fuels of non-biological origin in the energy supplied to the transport sector is at least 1% in 2025 and 5.5% in 2030, of which a share of at least 1 percentage point is from renewable fuels of non-biological origin in 2030.
column12: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Promoting Alternative Fuels" because it aims to increase the share of advanced biofuels and renewable fuels of non-biological origin in the transport sector.
column13: The target is part of the effort to promote alternative fuels and reduce dependence on fossil fuels, by setting obligations on fuel suppliers to increase the share of alternative fuels.

column11: The share of biofuels and biogas produced from the feedstock listed in Part B of Annex IX in the energy content of fuels and electricity supplied to the transport sector shall, except in Cyprus and Malta, be limited to 1.7%.
column12: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Promoting Sustainable Biofuels" because it aims to limit the share of biofuels produced from certain feedstocks.
column13: The target is part of the effort to promote sustainable biofuels and reduce the environmental impact of biofuel production, by limiting the use of biofuels produced from feedstocks with high environmental impact.

column11: States shall ensure that, at all airports of the TEN-T core network and TEN-T comprehensive network, the provision of electricity supply to stationary aircraft is ensured by 31 December 2029, at all aircraft remote stands used for commercial air transport operations to embark or disembark passengers or to load or unload goods
column12: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Improving Energy Efficiency" because it aims to increase the use of electricity to power stationary aircraft.
column13: The target is part of the effort to improve energy efficiency and reduce greenhouse gas emissions from the transport sector, by promoting the use of electricity instead of fossil fuels to power aircraft.

column11: Reduce transport emissions by at least 90% by 2050
column12: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Sustainable Transport" because it aims to drastically reduce emissions from the transport sector.

column11: Increase the share of alternative fuels in transport to at least 24% by 2030
column12: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Alternative Fuels" because it promotes the use of alternative fuels in the transport sector.

column11: Deploy at least 30 million zero-emission vehicles by 2030
column12: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Zero-Emission Vehicles" because it specifically targets the deployment of zero-emission vehicles.

column11: Improve public transport and promote walking and cycling
column12: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Sustainable Transport Modes" because it promotes sustainable modes of transport like public transport, walking, and cycling.

column2: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column11: Reduce by 50% the use of more hazardous pesticides
column12: This target is assigned to Pesticide Reduction as it promotes the reduction of hazardous pesticides.

column2: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column11: Increase organic farming with the aim to achieve at least 25% of total farmland under organic farming by 2030
column12: This target is assigned to Organic Farming as it promotes the increase of organic farming.

column2: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column11: Genetic biodiversity of food production systems: Secure and ensure access to a range of quality seeds for plant varieties in order to adapt to the pressures of climate change.
column12: This target is assigned to Biodiversity Conservation as it promotes the conservation of genetic biodiversity.

column2: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column11: Consumption footprint: Reduce the environmental and climate footprint of the EU food system, operating within planetary boundaries. Reduce the EU’s contribution to global deforestation and forest degradation.
column12: This target is assigned to Sustainable Consumption as it promotes the reduction of environmental and climate footprint.

column2: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column11: Price: Preserve the price affordability of food.
column12: This target is assigned to Food Affordability as it promotes the preservation of price affordability.

column2: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column11: Trade: Foster the competitiveness of the EU supply sector.
column12: This target is assigned to Trade Competitiveness as it promotes the competitiveness of the EU supply sector.

column2: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column11: Digitalisation and knowledge transfer. Ensure access to fast broadband to all farmers and all rural areas to achieve the objective of 100% access by 2025
column12: This target is assigned to Digitalization as it promotes the access to fast broadband.

column2: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column11: Transport, accessibility and infrastructure: Create shorter supply chains will support reducing dependence on long-haul transportation.
column12: This target is assigned to Sustainable Transport as it promotes the creation of shorter supply chains.

column2: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column11: Animal welfare: Promote better animal welfare to improve animal health and food quality.
column12: This target is assigned to Animal Welfare as it promotes the improvement of animal welfare.

column2: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column11: Reduce the use of chemical pesticides by 50% by 2030
column12: This target is assigned to Sustainable Agriculture as it aims to reduce the use of chemical pesticides.

column2: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column11: Increase the share of organic farming to at least 25% by 2030
column12: This target is assigned to Organic Farming as it aims to increase the share of organic farming.

column2: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column11: Reduce the generation of food waste by 30% by 2025
column12: This target is assigned to Food Waste Reduction as it aims to reduce food waste generation.

column2: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column11: Increase the use of recycled materials in packaging to 30% by 2030
column12: This target is assigned to Sustainable Packaging as it aims to increase the use of recycled materials in packaging.

column2: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column11: Reduce nutrient losses by at least 50%, while ensuring that there is no deterioration in soil fertility.
column12: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Improving Soil Health" because it aims to reduce nutrient losses and maintain soil fertility.
column13: The target is part of the effort to improve soil health and reduce the environmental impact of agriculture, by promoting sustainable farming practices and reducing nutrient losses.

column2: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column11: Sectorial growth: Help farmers and fishers to strengthen their position in the supply chain and to capture a fair share of the added value of sustainable production.
column12: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Promoting Sustainable Agriculture" because it aims to support farmers and fishers in sustainable production.
column13: The target is part of the effort to promote sustainable agriculture and improve the economic viability of farmers and fishers, by helping them to strengthen their position in the supply chain and capture a fair share of the added value of sustainable production.

column2: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column11: Employment and working conditions: Create new job opportunities. Improve working conditions, ensure occupation health and safety.
column12: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Improving Working Conditions" because it aims to create new job opportunities and improve working conditions in the agricultural sector.
column13: The target is part of the effort to improve the social sustainability of agriculture, by promoting decent working conditions and ensuring occupational health and safety.

column2: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column11: Food security: Ensuring food security and access to quality, safe, sustainable, nutritious food for all.
column12: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Ensuring Food Security" because it aims to ensure access to quality, safe, sustainable, and nutritious food for all.
column13: The target is part of the effort to ensure food security and promote sustainable food systems, by ensuring that everyone has access to healthy and nutritious food.

column2: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column11: Nutrition and healthy, sustainable diets: Move to healthier and more sustainable diets.
column12: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Promoting Healthy Diets" because it aims to promote healthier and more sustainable diets.
column13: The target is part of the effort to promote healthy and sustainable diets, by encouraging the consumption of nutritious and sustainable food.

column2: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column11: Preparedness, shock resilience, adaptation and transformation: Strengthen the resilience of the EU food system. Build up resilience to climate change, possible future diseases and pandemics. Increasing the sustainability of food producers will ultimately increase their resilience.
column12: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Improving Resilience" because it aims to strengthen the resilience of the EU food system.
column13: The target is part of the effort to improve the resilience of the food system, by promoting sustainable agriculture and reducing the risk of climate-related shocks and diseases.

column2: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column11: Reduce greenhouse gas emissions from agriculture by at least 55% by 2030
column12: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Agricultural Emissions Reduction" because it aims to reduce emissions from agricultural activities.

column2: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column11: Increase organic farming to at least 25% of total farmland by 2030
column12: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Organic Farming" because it promotes the expansion of organic farming practices.

column2: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column11: Reduce the use of chemical pesticides by 50% by 2030
column12: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Sustainable Pest Management" because it aims to reduce the use of chemical pesticides.

column2: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column11: Increase the share of plant-based diets and reduce food waste
column12: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Sustainable Food Systems" because it promotes plant-based diets and reduction of food waste, contributing to more sustainable food systems.

column11: 1.a Legally protect a minimum of 30% of the EU’s land area
column12: This target is assigned to Habitat Protection as it promotes the legal protection of land area.

column11: Urban ecosystems. Member States shall achieve, in each urban ecosystem area, determined in accordance with Article 14(4), an increasing trend of urban tree canopy cover, measured every six years after 31 December 2030, until the satisfactory level identified in accordance with Article 14(5) is reached.
column12: This target is assigned to Urban Biodiversity as it promotes the increase of urban tree canopy cover.

column11: Marine ecosystems. Member States shall ensure, by 2030 at the latest, that the condition is known for at least 50% of the area distributed over all habitat types listed in groups 1–6 of Annex II.
column12: This target is assigned to Marine Conservation as it promotes the conservation of marine ecosystems.

column11: Agricultural ecosystems. Member States shall put in place measures which shall aim to restore organic soils in agricultural use constituting drained peatlands.
column12: This target is assigned to Soil Conservation as it promotes the restoration of organic soils.

column11: Trees. When identifying and implementing the restoration measures to meet the objectives and obligations set out in Articles 4, 6, 7, 8, 9 and 10, Member States shall aim to contribute to the commitment of planting at least three billion additional trees by 2030 at Union level.
column12: This target is assigned to Reforestation as it promotes the planting of additional trees.

column11: Forest ecosystems. Member States shall achieve an increasing trend at national level of the common forest bird index, as further set out in Annex VI, measured in the period from the date of entry into force of this Regulation until 31 December 2030, and every six years thereafter, until the satisfactory levels identified in accordance with Article 11(3) are reached
column12: This target is assigned to Forest Conservation as it promotes the conservation of forest ecosystems.

column11: Member States shall take the measures necessary to ensure that water intended for human consumption is wholesome and clean, by meeting several requirements related to micro-organisms and parasites which constitute a potential danger to human health and quality standards recalled in the Directive.
column12: This target is assigned to Water Quality as it promotes the improvement of water quality.

column11: Protect at least 30% of the EU’s land area and 30% of the EU’s sea area by 2030
column12: This target is assigned to Habitat Protection as it aims to protect a significant portion of the EU's land and sea area.

column11: Restore at least 25,000 km of free-flowing rivers by 2030
column12: This target is assigned to River Restoration as it aims to restore free-flowing rivers.

column11: Plant at least 3 billion additional trees by 2030
column12: This target is assigned to Reforestation as it aims to plant additional trees.

column11: Reduce the use of chemical pesticides by 50% by 2030
column12: This target is assigned to Sustainable Agriculture as it aims to reduce the use of chemical pesticides.

column11: Increase the share of organic farming to at least 25% by 2030
column12: This target is assigned to Organic Farming as it aims to increase the share of organic farming.

column11: Legally protect a minimum of 30% of the EU's sea area
column12: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Protecting Marine Ecosystems" because it aims to protect a minimum of 30% of the EU's sea area.
column13: The target is part of the effort to protect marine ecosystems and promote biodiversity, by establishing marine protected areas and reducing human impact on the marine environment.

column11: Strictly protect at least a third of the EU'S protected areas
column12: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Protecting Terrestrial Ecosystems" because it aims to strictly protect at least a third of the EU's protected areas.
column13: The target is part of the effort to protect terrestrial ecosystems and promote biodiversity, by establishing protected areas and reducing human impact on the environment.

column11: The decline of pollinators is reversed
column12: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Protecting Pollinators" because it aims to reverse the decline of pollinators.
column13: The target is part of the effort to protect pollinators and promote biodiversity, by reducing the impact of human activities on pollinator populations and promoting sustainable agriculture practices.

column11: At least 10% of agricultural area is under high-diversity landscape features
column12: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Promoting Biodiversity in Agriculture" because it aims to increase the area of high-diversity landscape features in agriculture.
column13: The target is part of the effort to promote biodiversity in agriculture, by encouraging the use of sustainable agriculture practices and reducing the impact of agriculture on the environment.

column11: Three billion trees are planted in the EU, in full respect of ecological principles
column12: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Restoring Forests" because it aims to plant three billion trees in the EU.
column13: The target is part of the effort to restore forests and promote biodiversity, by planting trees and promoting sustainable forest management practices.

column11: At least 25.000 km of free-flowing rivers are restored
column12: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Restoring Rivers" because it aims to restore at least 25,000 km of free-flowing rivers.
column13: The target is part of the effort to restore rivers and promote biodiversity, by removing barriers and promoting sustainable river management practices.

column11: There is a 50% reduction in the number of Red List species threatened by Invasive Alien Species (IAS)
column12: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Preventing Invasive Species" because it aims to reduce the number of Red List species threatened by invasive alien species.
column13: The target is part of the effort to prevent the introduction and spread of invasive alien species, by promoting sustainable practices and reducing the impact of human activities on the environment.

column11: Cities with at least 20.000 inhabitants have an ambitious Urban Greening Plan
column12: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Promoting Urban Biodiversity" because it aims to promote urban greening plans in cities with at least 20,000 inhabitants.
column13: The target is part of the effort to promote urban biodiversity, by encouraging the creation of green spaces and reducing the impact of urbanization on the environment.

column11: Terrestrial ecosystems. Member States shall put in place [...] measures [...] to jointly cover, as a Union target, throughout the areas and ecosystems [...] defined in Art. 2, by 2030, at least 20% of land areas in need of restoration and, by 2050, all ecosystems in need of restoration.
column12: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Restoring Ecosystems" because it aims to restore at least 20% of land areas in need of restoration by 2030 and all ecosystems in need of restoration by 2050.
column13: The target is part of the effort to restore ecosystems and promote biodiversity, by promoting sustainable land use practices and reducing the impact of human activities on the environment.

column11: Member States shall take the necessary measures to attain a recycling target of 70% of glass by weight of glass contained in packaging waste generated by 31 December 2025 and of 75% by 31 December 2030
column12: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Promoting Recycling" because it aims to increase the recycling rate of glass packaging waste.
column13: The target is part of the effort to promote recycling and reduce waste, by increasing the recycling rate of glass packaging waste and promoting sustainable practices.

column11: Natural connectivity of rivers and natural functions of the related floodplains. Member States shall make an inventory of artificial barriers and remove them to connectivity of surface waters and, taking into account their socio-economic functions, identify the barriers that need to be removed to contribute to the achievement of the restoration targets set out in Article 4 of this Regulation and of the objective of restoring at least 25.000 km of rivers into free-flowing rivers in the Union.
column12: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Restoring Rivers" because it aims to restore natural connectivity of rivers and remove artificial barriers.
column13: The target is part of the effort to restore rivers and promote biodiversity, by removing barriers and promoting sustainable river management practices.

column11: Member States shall, by putting in place in a timely manner appropriate and effective measures, improve pollinator diversity and reverse the decline of pollinator populations at the latest by 2030 and thereafter achieve an increasing trend of pollinator populations, measured at least every six years from 2030, until satisfactory levels are achieved, as set in accordance with Article 14(5).
column12: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Protecting Pollinators" because it aims to improve pollinator diversity and reverse the decline of pollinator populations.
column13: The target is part of the effort to protect pollinators and promote biodiversity, by reducing the impact of human activities on pollinator populations and promoting sustainable agriculture practices.

column11: Ecosystems. Member States shall put in place the restoration measures that are necessary to re-establish the habitat types of groups 1-6 listed in Annex II in areas not covered by those habitat types with the aim to reach their favourable reference area.
column12: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Restoring Ecosystems" because it aims to restore habitat types and promote biodiversity.
column13: The target is part of the effort to restore ecosystems and promote biodiversity, by promoting sustainable land use practices and reducing the impact of human activities on the environment.

column11: Protect and restore at least 30% of land and sea areas by 2030
column12: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Biodiversity Conservation" because it aims to protect and restore significant portions of land and sea areas for biodiversity.

column11: Restore at least 25,000 kilometers of free-flowing rivers by 2030
column12: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "River Restoration" because it specifically targets the restoration of free-flowing rivers.

column11: Plant at least 3 billion trees by 2030
column12: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Reforestation" because it promotes the planting of a significant number of trees.

column11: Reduce the risk and use of chemical pesticides by 50% by 2030
column12: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Sustainable Pest Management" because it aims to reduce the risk and use of chemical pesticides, which is crucial for biodiversity conservation.

column2: TA7_Towards a zero-pollution ambition for a toxic free environment
column11: Improve soil quality by reducing nutrient losses use by 50%, by 2030
column12: This target is assigned to Soil Conservation as it promotes the improvement of soil quality.

column2: TA7_Towards a zero-pollution ambition for a toxic free environment
column11: Improve water quality by reducing microplastics released into the environment (by 30%)
column12: This target is assigned to Water Quality as it promotes the improvement of water quality.

column2: TA7_Towards a zero-pollution ambition for a toxic free environment
column11: Reduce the number of premature deaths caused by air pollution by 55% by 2030
column12: This target is assigned to Air Pollution Reduction as it aims to reduce premature deaths caused by air pollution.

column2: TA7_Towards a zero-pollution ambition for a toxic free environment
column11: Reduce the concentration of microplastics in the environment by 30% by 2030
column12: This target is assigned to Microplastics Reduction as it aims to reduce the concentration of microplastics in the environment.

column2: TA7_Towards a zero-pollution ambition for a toxic free environment
column11: Reduce the share of people chronically disturbed by transport noise by 30% by 2030
column12: This target is assigned to Noise Pollution Reduction as it aims to reduce the share of people chronically disturbed by transport noise.

column2: TA7_Towards a zero-pollution ambition for a toxic free environment
column11: Reduce the generation of waste by 50% by 2030
column12: This target is assigned to Waste Reduction as it aims to reduce waste generation.

column2: TA7_Towards a zero-pollution ambition for a toxic free environment
column11: Increase the recycling rate of municipal waste to 65% by 2030
column12: This target is assigned to Waste Recycling as it aims to increase the recycling rate of municipal waste.

column2: TA7_Towards a zero-pollution ambition for a toxic free environment
column11: Improve soil quality by reducing chemical pesticides’ use by 50%, by 2030
column12: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Reducing Chemical Pollution" because it aims to reduce the use of chemical pesticides and improve soil quality.
column13: The target is part of the effort to reduce chemical pollution and promote sustainable agriculture practices, by reducing the use of chemical pesticides and promoting alternative methods of pest control.

column2: TA7_Towards a zero-pollution ambition for a toxic free environment
column11: Reduce by 25% the EU ecosystems where air pollution threatens biodiversity, by 2030 (compared to 2005)
column12: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Reducing Air Pollution" because it aims to reduce the number of EU ecosystems where air pollution threatens biodiversity.
column13: The target is part of the effort to reduce air pollution and promote biodiversity, by reducing emissions and promoting sustainable practices.

column2: TA7_Towards a zero-pollution ambition for a toxic free environment
column11: Reduce by 25% the EU ecosystems where air pollution threatens biodiversity, by 2030 (compared to 2005)
column12: This target is also assigned to the sub-theme "Protecting Ecosystems" because it aims to protect EU ecosystems from air pollution.
column13: The target is part of the effort to protect ecosystems and promote biodiversity, by reducing the impact of air pollution on ecosystems and promoting sustainable practices.

column2: TA7_Towards a zero-pollution ambition for a toxic free environment
column11: Reduce air pollution to levels that do not harm human health and the environment by 2030
column12: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Air Quality Improvement" because it aims to reduce air pollution to safe levels for human health and the environment.

column2: TA7_Towards a zero-pollution ambition for a toxic free environment
column11: Reduce waste generation by at least 50% by 2030
column12: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Waste Reduction" because it focuses on significantly reducing waste generation.

column2: TA7_Towards a zero-pollution ambition for a toxic free environment
column11: Reduce the use of single-use plastics by 50% by 2030
column12: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Single-Use Plastics Reduction" because it specifically targets the reduction of single-use plastics.

column2: TA7_Towards a zero-pollution ambition for a toxic free environment
column11: Improve water quality by reducing pollution from agricultural and industrial activities
column12: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Water Quality Improvement" because it aims to reduce pollution in water bodies from various activities.

column2: TA7_Towards a zero-pollution ambition for a toxic free environment
column11: Reduce soil pollution by at least 50% by 2030
column12: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Soil Pollution Reduction" because it focuses on reducing soil pollution.

column2: TA7_Towards a zero-pollution ambition for a toxic free environment
column11: Reduce noise pollution to levels that do not harm human health by 2030
column12: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Noise Pollution Reduction" because it aims to reduce noise pollution to safe levels for human health.
